See Laptop for generic laptop-related information, or ThinkPad for other ThinkPad laptops.

sections.title: Secure Boot
sections.content:
Secure Boot with custom keys is fully and officially supported.

Install the sbctl package. In UEFI, enable Secure Boot and set Platform Mode to Setup Mode. Then, follow https://github.com/Foxboron/sbctl#key-creation-and-enrollment and https://github.com/Foxboron/sbctl#signatures.

sections.title: Built-in audio
sections.content:
This laptop requires Sound Open Firmware in order for the soundcard to work.

Blacklist the snd_hda_intel and snd_soc_skl modules.

Configure PulseAudio's to load ALSA modules with the correct device and channnel settings, by adding these two lines to /etc/pulse/default.pa:

```
load-module module-alsa-sink device=hw:0,0 channels=4
load-module module-alsa-source device=hw:0,6 channels=4
```

Unmute the Master channel:

```
$ alsamixer -c 0
```

Then press m on your keyboard.

sections.title: Video
sections.content: The X1 Extreme comes with two graphics cards: the Intel CometLake UHD and Nvidia GeForce GTX 1650 Ti. The display is connected to the Intel card and the HDMI port is physically connected to the GeForce.

sections.title: Xorg.conf with PRIME
sections.content:
Using the proprietary driver from NVIDIA, you can set the laptop to run on Intel and only use NVIDIA if triggered manually by running prime-run. To do so, the xorg.conf needs to explicitly define NVIDIA as a nonâ€“primary GPU:

```
Option "PrimaryGPU" "no"
```

No configuration for Intel is needed unless tweaking is required.

Follow PRIME for full featured setup.

sections.title: Integrated webcam
sections.content: The integrated webcam needs the uvcvideo kernel module to be loaded to work. See Kernel module for module-loading instructions.

sections.title: Trackpoint and trackpad
sections.content:
It may be necessary to add the following to configure the psmouse module to get the trackpoint and trackpad to respond at all.

```
# rmmod psmouse
# modprobe psmouse proto=exps
```

To permanently make the change

```
/etc/modprobe.d/psmouse.conf
```

```
options psmouse proto=exps
```
